page.title: 03WEATHERHEAD HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: Our school began in 1883. One of the men who founded it was Canon Weatherhead. His daughter Irene was a good pupil. The school first rented rooms in Liscard but in 1890 it moved to two houses in Manor Road. These houses are called Manor Mansions now. They are flats for 12 families and owned by Mr. Rubens. In 1909 the school moved to a purpose built site in Manor Road. We still use this site today as our middle site. Old school magazines are in our library. In 1952 we found out that there was a French exchange with a school from Cognac. Today a French teacher from Cognac still brings French children to stay in Wallasey. In 1964 the uniform was like ours today, but the prefects had badges. Our form captains wear badges now.
